alert.note: Alert for Clay; Norman; Wilkin (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued April 03 at 12:03PM CDT until April 06 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM TUESDAY TO 7 AM CDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 9 to 19 inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze. Winds gusting as high as 45 to 50 mph. * WHERE...Portions of northwest and west central Minnesota and southeast North Dakota. * WHEN...From 6 AM Tuesday to 7 AM CDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult to impossible. Widespread falling and blowing snow will significantly reduce the visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning and evening commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Blizzard force winds will not occur during the entire time frame. However, whiteout conditions due to heavy falling snow may.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. The latest road conditions for North Dakota can be found at travel.dot.nd.gov and for Minnesota at 511mn.org, or by calling 5 1 1 in either state.
